alert.note: Alert for King George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 10 at 6:22PM EDT until August 10 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maryland and Virginia, including the following counties: in Maryland, Charles and Prince Georges. In Virginia, King George and Stafford. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 622 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waldorf... Clinton... Fort Washington... La Plata... King George... Dahlgren... Fairview Beach... Nanjemoy Creek... Potomac Creek... Aquia Creek... Friendly... Saint Charles... Accokeek... Bryans Road... Brandywine... Mason Neck... Passapatanzy... Potomac Heights... Pomfret... Port Tobacco Village... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
